Title: the dead hooker juxtaposition

Scene: The lobby, there are boxes everywhere and removal men are carrying them up the stairs.
The apartment. Sheldon is writing on an imaginary board. There is a knock on the door.
The apartment. Penny walks in without knocking and collapses on the sofa.
The apartment. Penny has a black eye.
Penny: Okay, it’s done. Look, guys, for the future, I don’t mind killing the big spiders, but you have to at least try with the little ones.
Not with a thousand condoms, Howard.
Okay, new topic, please. Hey, did you hear the people upstairs in 5A are moving out?
The people upstairs are moving out.
How else was I supposed to say it?
Sheldon, I’m sure it’s going to be fine.
Okay, honey, did you even know the people that are moving out?
Well, I’m sure the new people will be just as quiet.
You’re right, I can’t. You know what? Anyone could rent that apartment now, an opera singer, the cast of stomp, yeah, a tap-dancing pirate with a wooden leg.
I tried making it better, he wouldn’t go for it.
The horror!
Hi.
I can see.
Oh, yeah, I don’t usually dress like this. I’m going jogging.
I can start.
Thank you, Sheldon.
Oh, yeah, be careful.
Okay.
See ya. I’m dressed like a slob today, too.
Well, sort of.
I bought new clothes, okay? Is Leonard around?
Oh. all right, that’s cool, no biggie. He said he’d help me set up my printer, but I guess I can wait. What exactly is he doing up there?
Oh, they’re all up there, huh? Hmm, typical.
Okay, now I see the giant squid head. (Leaves)
Hey, I just wanted to bring you a little housewarming gift.
Great.
Oh, this? I’m dressed like a slob today.
Yeah.
That is so awesome.
Yeah, I know, tell me about it.
That’s why I work at the Cheesecake Factory, I’m holding out for the right part.

Uh, hey, guys, guys, you will really appreciate this, I read the best science joke on the internet. Alicia, you won’t get it, but it’s right up their alley. Anyway, so, this physicist goes into an ice cream parlour every week and orders an ice cream sundae for himself, and then offers one to the empty stool sitting next to him. This goes on for a while until the owner finally asks him what he’s doing. The man says, “well, I’m a physicist, and quantum mechanics teaches us that it is possible for the matter above this stool to spontaneously turn into a beautiful woman who might accept my offer and fall in love with me.” The owner then says, “well, lots of single, beautiful women come in here every day, why don’t you buy an ice cream for one of them, and they might fall in love with you?” And the physicist says, “yeah, but what are the odds of that happening?”
How would I know? I’m not even sure I get it.
Uh, hey, maybe when you’re done with her printer, you could set up mine. You know, like you promised a week ago.
Well, they’re all still up there.
I don’t even know why I care. I don’t care. All right, I cared enough to memorize that stupid joke, but that’s all I care.
What are you saying, that I’m threatened by Alicia? That I’m like the old queen of the hive and it’s just time for me to go?
Bees. Aaah! I just got that physicist joke.
No, no occasion, just felt like getting some Chinese chow for my peeps.
Yes.
Yes.
Yes.
Yes.
Yes
So, what do we got going on tonight, huh? Playing Halo watching Battlestar, drop some mentos in diet coke?
What can I say? I got my geek on, boys.
Oh, actually, that’s okay. we already have…
…chinese food right here.

I cannot believe they’re letting her just use them like that. I mean, anything she wants, they go panting after her like trained dogs. You know that just last week, she had Howard drive all the way to her uncle’s house in Orange County to pick up her TV?

Apples and oranges here, Sheldon. I’m telling you, that girl is a user, iceskating through the life on her looks, taking advantage of innocent weak-willed men, getting auditions for stupid network shows. It creams my corn.
Please.
Oh boy.
Uh, no. No, no, no, you know, congratulations, I think you’ll make a great hooker.
Um, I don’t know, I don’t think a lot.
Um, hey, hey, can I talk to you about that for a second?
Well, you know, it’s just that Leonard and Howard and Raj, they aren’t like other guys. They’re special.
Oh, let’s see, how can I explain this, um, they don’t know how to use their shields.

Yeah, you know, like in Star Trek, when you’re in battle and you raise the shields? Where the hell did that come from? Anyways, um, you know how guys like this are, so, please don’t take advantage of them.
Come on, they’re doing everything for you, because you’re leading them on.
Excuse me?
Okay, lady, you are way out of line.
Yeah, you’re out of line.
Thank you.
Well, dead whore on TV, live one in real life.
Sheldon: Penny, please, we’re facing a far more serious problem than stray arachnids.
Not bad? It’s horrible. I mean, you hear stories about this sort of thing, but you never think it’ll happen to you.
What?
The horror!
No, no, no, no, no, no, no…
The horror!
No, it’s not going to be fine, change is never fine. They say it is, but it’s not.

I never met them. That’s what made them perfect, there were no awkward hellos in the halls, there was no clickety-clacking of high heel shoes on hardwood floors, they may as well have been a family of cats just jumping around from drape to drape without that annoying ammonia urine smell.
You can’t know that. How can you possibly know that?
Hold on. You honestly expect me to believe that social protocol dictates we break our backs helping Wolowitz move, and then he only need buy us a pizza?
You’re tricking me. You tell me the truth, what do we get?
I knew it! PS3, definitely  PS3, who would pick a mountain bike?
Oh, no, the new ones, they’re here.
I’m checking for musical instruments. Does that sound like castanets to you?
So? Do cocaine smugglers write cocaine on the box?
Hello.
Hello.
If that concludes your faltering attempt to mate, hello.
Hello. On a scale of one to ten how light of foot would you describe yourself with one being not cat-like at all and ten being freakishly feline?
Is that your answer or do you not understand the question? We’ll come back to that one.
Hang on. Are you now or have you ever been a salsa, Irish folk or break-dancer?
Oh, I’m sorry. Well, if it helps you feel any better you’re doing very well so far. Next question, are you fertile?
I’m trying to determine whether crying infants above my head are a possibility.
If that changes, let me know. And finally, area rugs, pro or con?
Alicia?
Welcome to the building.
Alicia’s non-musical, childless and pro-rug. She’s still on probation, of course, but I like her.
You don’t jog.
True, but the more likely explanation for your attire is that you’re out of clean clothes again.
You’re welcome, Penny.
Oh, mimicry. I enjoy mimicry. I’ve been working on Admiral Ackbar from Return of the Jedi. “It’s a trap.” You have to imagine me with a giant squid head. “It’s a trap. It’s a trap. It’s a trap.”
Come.
Congratulations, I see you did your laundry.
How does one sort of…
He’s upstairs at Alicia’s.
In what I can only perceive as a tactical move to destroy me, he is with Wolowitz and Koothrappali setting up her stereo.

It’s axiomatically atypical. Up until recently, they did not know Alicia, and had no encounters with her in a previous location. They never went upstairs to visit the former tenants, so your characterization of their behaviour as typical Is demonstrably fallacious.
Oh, great! now, I have to start all over again. (Rubs out imaginary workings)
Who is it? Oh hello, Penny, it’s open, come in. Sarcasm.
You think I can’t hear them? Listen to that. Stomp, stomp, stomp. That’s Wolowitz in his stacked heels that fool no one.

You know, Penny, there’s something that occurs in beehives you might find interesting. Occasionally, a new queen will arrive while the old queen is still in power. When this happens, the old queen must either locate to a new hive or engage in a battle to the death until only one queen remains.
I’m just talking about bees. They’re on the discovery channel. What are you talking about?
Did you remember to ask for the chicken with broccoli to be diced, not shredded?
Even though the menu description specifies shredded?
Brown rice, not white?
You stop at the Korean grocery and get the good hot mustard?
Did you pick up the low-sodium soy sauce from the market?
Good. See how it’s done, Leonard?
They’re gone, Penny. They can’t hear you.
You once had Leonard and me get your television from your ex-boyfriend.
May I interject something here?
You got the wrong mustard.
Only the modern green lantern is vulnerable to yellow.
Oh, great now she’s jumping up and down on the bed.
Leonard: So they steamed your dumplings, get over it. New topic, please.
Why would you just say something like that?
Slowly, like putting a new fish in a tank. You don’t just drop it in, you let the bag sit in the water a while.
Why are you making it worse?
I’m sorry, that really is how it works.
Stay calm, we don’t know anything about them yet. What are you doing?
That is so great. Oh, I’m Leonard, I live downstairs. Upstairs from here, but under you. Not under you per se, but under your apartment.
Thank you so much for giving me the opportunity to help.
Hey, Penny. this is Alicia, our new neighbour.
Hey, uh, penny, you want to hear something awesome?
Alicia is an actress, just like you.
Alicia, what do you want as your default setting for DVDs, 5.1 Dolby or DTS?
Well, DTS has more low end, so… okay.
It’s a little insulting, don’t you think?
Yeah, I’ll get to it, don’t nag me.
Gee, Penny, thanks for buying us dinner.
Golden age green lantern was vulnerable to wood.
I had to, she called me cutie.
Howard: All right, Penny, let me take this opportunity to point out that you are looking particularly ravishing today.
I’ll take the apartment upstairs. I can finally get away from my mother, and we can all spend some more time together, if you catch my drift.
Yeah, I thought about renting this apartment, but I’m really more of a downtown loft kind of guy.
Oh, actually I’m, uh, living with a woman in Altadena. Purely platonic, she’s also my maid.
I won’t lie, it’s pretty dope.
Oh, pish-posh. (Raj whispers to him) I don’t know, it means shucks. (Raj whispers again) Shucks means shucks. Let one go once in a while.
I’ll run lines with you in the car.
Oh, my God! Girl fight! (He grabs Leonard)
I know you. you’re stupid enough to break it up.
May I say you look very comely tonight?
You’re right, this filly’s been broken.
According to Alicia’s facebook page, she’s hooking up with one of the producers on CSI.
Howard (after Raj whispers to him): You’re right, that’s a great idea.
No, no, PMS is different. (There is a knock on the door. Leonard answers it.)
Raj: You get to choose between a mountain bike or a PS3.
I like green lantern, I’m just saying it’s pretty lame that He can be defeated by the colour yellow.
Great, so I can take them both out with a number-two pencil?
Howard (voice from inside): Enough with the guilt, ma, we’ll still see each other. I’ll come over every night and have dinner with you.
Howard\u2019s Mother (voice): The hell you will! What am I running here, a fancy restaurant? Does this look like Olive Garden?
Little bird? You’re almost 30, fly, for god’s sake!
Howard (voice): Okay, I get it, you’re angry. You don’t want to see your little bird leave the nest.
Fine, I’ll stay! You happy, crazy lady? I sure as hell hope so, because you’re ruining my life!
Leonard (into phone): Hey, Penny, it’s Leonard. Good news, you can take your head out of the oven.
Sheldon (removing hernia support): I guess I won’t be needing this.
Blonde Girl: I’m Alicia. I’m moving in upstairs.
Alicia: Thanks so much for helping me, Leonard.
Please, you look cute. I’m dressed like a slob today, too.
Cool. so are you in a loft now?
That is so sweet. Come on in, let’s open it.
The guys have been helping me set up my sound system. I’ve never had such good-looking technical support.
Well, trying to be, but it’s so hard.
I’ve been out here three months, and all I’ve gotten is a couple of national commercials and this recurring thing on a soap.
Whatever you think is best, cutie.
Hey, Leonard? If you’re done with the DVD player, can you set up my printer?
Oh, thank God you’re home. I need help.
I just got a callback to audition for CSI to play a hooker who gets killed.
But my car is in the shop, and I have to be at Universal in forty-five minutes.
Great. And afterward, I’ll take you all out for Chinese.
Guess what? I got the part on CSI.
Thank you. Hey, I got to ask you something, how much do physicists make?
Yeah, that’s what I figured. Well, got to run, the guys promised to set up my satellite dish and paint my bedroom. Yay!
Who says I’m taking advantage of them?
So I let them do stuff for me. They’re happy. I get stuff. Who cares? And how’s it any different from what you do?
I’ve seen you around them. Are you pretending like you don’t do the exact same thing?
Well, what are you going to do about it, bitch?
Sheldon (as music comes down through cei: You set it on DTS, didn’t you?
